field_label:
Top tips for taking your blood sample at home


Read through all of the instructions before you begin.

Allow around 20 minutes to take your blood sample.

Take the sample when your body is warm, for example after a hot shower or exercise. Holding a warm drink for a few minutes or running your hand under warm water can also help.

If you don't manage to fill both sample tubes, don't worry. We would still be happy to receive the volume of blood that you have been able to collect.

Wash your hands. Sit down at a clean table and lay the test kit out.

The kit contains: 2 sample tubes, 2 lancets, 1 alcohol wipe, 1 sterile gauze, 2 plasters and 1 postal kit.

Remove the yellow caps from the sample tubes.

Place the tubes upright in the grooves of the plastic case.

Twist and pull the blue cap off the lancet.

Donâ€™t touch the newly exposed white part as this will activate the lancet.

Clean your middle or ring finger with the alcohol wipe.

Press your thumb towards the end of your finger so it turns pink.
With your thumb in place, press the lancet firmly into the side of your finger until you hear a click.

Hold your hand over the sample tube. Massage down your finger so blood drops into the tube.

Fill both tubes to the 600 mark. Use the 2nd lancet on a different finger if needed.

Push the yellow caps back onto the sample tubes.

Gently turn each tube upside down 5 times.

Fix the sticky labels to the sample tubes.

Put both tubes in the plastic case.

Close the case so it snaps shut.

Fill out the return form. Put it in the grey postal bag along with the plastic case containing your samples. Seal the bag shut.

Stick the Royal Mail label on the grey postal bag and post it on the same day.
